metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11735 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Mozilla developers and community members reported memory safety bugs present in Firefox 68 and Firefox ESR 68. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort that some of these could be exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 69 and Firefox ESR < 68.1.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11735` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 69.0.1+build1-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '69.0.1+build1-0ubuntu2').
